DOC.brief_summary: To determine effect use robotic exoskeleton allow walk practice stroke , compare usual physiotherapy care , recovery walk ability secondary outcome .
DOC.detailed_description: Participants admit inpatient stroke rehabilitation physiotherapy service randomly assign either Exoskeleton Program Usual Care Program . Individuals Exoskeleton Program usual physiotherapy session replace exoskeleton intervention . The exoskeleton allow stand walk first session rehabilitation , exoskeleton provide physical support allow walk full weight-bearing without limited therapist fatigue lifting requirement . Individuals Usual Care Program receive standard physiotherapy care , individualize hands-on therapist regain walking , mobility , independent function . Both group conduct 3-5 day week , 30-60 minute per session discharge ( maximum 8 week ) . Participants assess baseline , discharge , 6-months start rehabilitation .
DOC.criteria: Have admit hospital unit stroke treatment Stroke within last 3 month Onesided hemiparesis 19 year old Requires 2person assist walk Able communicate follow instruction Prescribed receive physiotherapy care Stroke nonvascular origin ( e.g . tumour , infection ) Significant musculoskeletal neurological condition Comorbidities would preclude activity Pregnant Unable walk prior stroke < 60 inch > 74 inch height > 220 pound weight Joint contracture spasticity would limit safe use Ekso exoskeleton
